text: Bottle @ Johns. Pours dark amber with a small offwhite head. Aroma of sweet malt, rich caramel, candy sugar, wood, alcohol. Flavor is very sweet, rich malty, caramel, candy sugar, wood, alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 7-3-7-4-15. 170617

Bottle @ Saxo tasting. 12.4 % ABV. Light hazy amber brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit and a little alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Soft. 170617

Bottle, 12.4%. Dark amber with small tan head. Aroma is malt, malt, caramel, toasted, oak and wood. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, oak, wood, sweet, warming, notes of alcohol, dark fruit and a little boozy.
Bottle. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter nice powerfull candis notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate.
Bottle @ Højbjerg tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, malt, hops, toffee and has a nice sweet finish.

Bottle at Naiv, Frankfurt. Pours dark red brown with a small bubbly tan coloured head. Aroma of toffee, raisin, plum, fig, chocolate, cardboard and alcohol. Medium to heavy sweetness, light bitterness. Full bodied, oily texture, soft to flat carbonation. Easy drinking, and delicious.

Bottle. Roast, rum soaked raisins, fresh berries, light oak, a bit oxidized. Hazy orange brown, creamy golden head. Full body, mellow sticky. Oxidized wooden spoon, fermented prison juice. Hops, orange peel, dry plums, muddled sticky finish.
Bottle. Brown color with some floatees and tan head. Aroma is raisins, toffee, fudge. Taste is toffee, caramel, fudge. Silky mouthfeel, warming finish. Very nice!

Dunkles Bernstein, leicht rötlich mit beigem Schaum. Geruch ist malzig süß und würzig. Erinnert etwas an Dörrobst. Geschmacklich dominiert auch der süße Malzkörper, aber auch die recht deutliche bittere tritt ins Rampenlicht. Beides harmoniert wunderbar. Der Alkohol ist recht präsent aber nicht störend. Gut.

330 ml bottle. Pours a nearly clear dark copper with a beige head. The aroma is malty - caramel, brioche, honey and dried fruits with noticeable hoppy notes. Full oily body with a low carbonation and a strong sweetness. Rich malty flavor with similar aromas to the smell, again caramel, honey and dried fruits, some spices, some woody notes, nuts. Overall very well balanced and the alcohol is not to intrusive for the high ABV.

330 ml bottle, dark amber, hazy with particles, beige rather creamy head.

malty, toffee, raisins, dried fruits, fermented grapes, sweet-ish, well hidden alcohol.
very balanced aromas and balanced taste, full body, creamy to sticky texture. soft carbonisation. rather easy to drink.

Many thanks to Beerhunter111 for sharing! Smooth grainy beginning. Hints of alcohol, caramel, smooth sweetish malt. Intense refreshing smooth aftertaste, round and deep, roasted, burned brown sugar. Very nice, complex, but a bit too alcoholic.
Drank with Rik in "Kanguruh" in Vienna 10-2-2017. Good Barley Wine, comprehensive taste. Bitter with a sweet aftertaste.
Bottle 330 ml, trade with Werckmeister. Shared with JFK10000. Pours amber, off white head. Malty, caramel, dried fruit, raisins, warming, quite sweet, toasted. Full bodied.
33cl bottle. Pours dark orange golden colour with a small beige head. Aroma of intense ripe fruits, wood, glue, alcohol. Taste of strong riped malt, red fruits, wood, vanilla, alcohol.
Süß malziger Antrunk, getreidig, Steigende Süße, das Malzig bleibt konstant und damit auf hohem Level. Süffig, weich, gleichzeitig aber auch alkoholisch. Okay. 9/8/9/7/9/9

Bottle, pours ruby brown with a light beige head. Malty, elderberries, dark bread, woody notes, raisins, unripe plums, dark cherries, cinnamon. Sweet, moderate bitterness, oily, full body, somewhat boozy. Nice.

21st October 2016Bright clear deep amber beer, tidy pale tan head. Palate is airy, semi dry and has reasonable fine carbonation. Toffee malts, quite light. Mild brandy, touch of spice. Decent generic fruits. Light spicy finish. Handles its abv well and is quite drinkable.
33cl bottle at home. Pale dark amber with a small off-white head. Full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Malts, caramel, ripe fruits and warming alcohol. Nice one.

(Brew Age Eisknacker) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 12.2%
Deep red to amber colour on the body, with a small beige head on top, good density, average retention.
Aroma of caramel, red fruits, sugars, alcohol, vanilla, raisins.
Taste is sweet and boozy, with caramel, red fruits, vanilla, marmalade, some plums, sugars.
Medium thick body with good carbonation.
Pretty good.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Malt and Candied fruit in the aroma. Malty very sweet flavor with citrus, raisin. Alcohol hidden by the intense sweetness. Pleasant dessert beer.

Great dark color, no head. some fruits, plums, raisins, quite nice smell. smells rather fresh for an eisbock. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of dried fruits, nice balanced barely wine.
Tap at Craft Bier Fest Wien. aroma of dried fruits, caramel. Taste, caramel, drieid fruits, candies, honey. Warming alcohol. Very good.
Tap at Craft Bier Fest Wien. Lots of dried fruits and caramel, slightly less complex than I would like to be honest. Lots of sweetness and warming alcohol. Quite good, but not the star of the show.

Bottle at Craft Bier Fest Linz: Brown color, yellowish/light brownish low head. Aroma is malty, nutty, sweet, some roastiness, alcohol, some cacao. Flavor is malty, sweet, medium alcoholic, notes of caramel, nuts. Was expecting more, maybe some aging would help?

Bottle. Dark brown body with white head. Aroma is nice malty caramel with some almonds. Taste is caramel, wine and raisins. Aftertaste is sweet and some alcohol with nearly no bitterness. I think this needs some aging.

330 ml bottle at 12.2% ABV, bottled 01.03.2016, courtesy of Werkmeister, thanks!
Dark copper, clear body, with a small, creamy, beige head.
Aroma of dried fruits, caramel, marzipan, cocoa, alcohol.
Tastes of almonds and other nuts, dried fruits, berries, caramel, cocoa, some tobacco, booze.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes boozy, sweet, moderate roasty, a bit dry, with nuts, cocoa, some tobacco.

Tasty. Boozy and heavy, with lots of lovely sweet layers, but well balanced, never too sweet. Liked this much better than the Nussknacker, complex and really smooth to drink.

0,33l bottle at home shared by a friend, big thanks. Bottled 01.03.2016. BB 25.11.2018. dark brown color, small tan head. smells of marzipan, nutty, spices, some fruits, plums, raisins, quite nice smell. smells rather fresh for an eisbock. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of dried fruits, plums, raisins, quite a lot of marzipan, nutty, quite creamy, some sweetness, alcohol only lightly noticeable, overall quite good stuff, a bit alcoholic but not disturbing. nice one.
